title: Alabama - Scout Financial Management

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Alabama - Scout Financial Management
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Under the Freedom of Information Act, I am requesting copies of the current contracts, and all amendments thereto, for your institution’s current vendor contract with any and all parties for the following areas:

(1) Any signed and/or executed contract/agreement/partnership/offer letter/proposal/memorandum of understanding between the University of Alabama and Scout Financial Management, and

(2) Any subsequent signed and/or executed contract extension/amendment/offer letter/memorandum of understanding of such, between Alabama and Scout.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Ellen.

title: City of Newburgh NY Annual Financial Disclosure Letters

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: City of Newburgh NY Annual Financial Disclosure Letters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide copies of the most recent Annual Financial Disclosure Letter filed by each local officer and employee required to file such letters under Chapter 34, Article II of the City of Newburgh Code. The relevant provisions of the City Code are available at: https://ecode360.com/10870585.

Under Section 34-11 of the City Code, the following officers and employees are required to file Annual Financial Disclosure Letters:
- All elected officials;
- All members of appointed boards or commissions;
- The City Manager;
- All department heads and their deputies, whether employed by the City of Newburgh or any City agency; and
- Any additional City staff whose positions or titles have been designated by the City Council, via resolution or local law, as subject to the disclosure requirements.

We acknowledge that Annual Financial Disclosure Letters may contain certain sensitive private information that may be exempt from disclosure under state or federal law, and we understand that this information may be redacted prior to disclosure under Section 34-14 of the City Code. The Committee on Open Government has provided guidance regarding this issue in several advisory opinions, and the City may find these opinions to be helpful in responding to our FOIL request:
- FOIL-AO-17694: https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f17694.html
- FOIL-AO-13559: https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/13559.htm
- FOIL-AO-f9826: https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f9826.htm
- FOIL-AO-f19757: https://docs.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f19757.html
- FOIL-AO-17351: https://docs.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f17351.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Liberty Street Legal PLLC

Dear Madeline Jennings 
 
The City of Bridgeport has received your request as of: June 15, 2025. We are in the process of reviewing your request, and you will be notified in writing of any updates, or if your requested records are available. Your request has been given the reference number W036975-061525 for tracking purposes. 
 
Please be aware that, pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, the City of Bridgeport is not obligated to answer questions, conduct research, or create records in response to a request; the City is required to provide copies of all non-exempt responsive records. THE CITY OF BRIDGEPORT

title: Stanley Nelson

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stanley Nelson
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

I request all records related to Stanley Skylar Nelson, the journalist who investigated civil rights cases. He was born on 18 September 1955 and died on 5 June 2025.

PROOF OF DEATH

I have attached the subject's news obituary from NPR.

SCOPE OF SEARCH

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction.

FEES

I have no commercial interest in this request, and all records produced in response to this request will be made available immediately to the general public online, for free, via muckrock.com. Please notify me before processing this request if you expect fees to exceed $25.

title: Illinois FOIA Request—Death Investigation of Christian Acosta (June 13, 2018) (Westmont Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

To:
 FOIA Officer
 Village of Westmont Police Department
 500 North Cass AvenueTo:
 FOIA Officer
 Westmont Police Department
 500 North Cass Avenue
 Westmont, IL 60559
 foia@westmont.il.gov

 FOIA Officer
 DuPage County State’s Attorney’s Office
 505 N. County Farm Road
 Wheaton, IL 60187
 SAOFOIA@dupageco.org

From:
 Alexander Liam Lennon
 215 S Century Ave #227
 Waunakee, WI 53597
 (608) 214-6492 | alennon727@gmail.com

I. Statutory Authority
 This request is made pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.

II. Records Requested
 Please produce all records, in any format, relating to the investigation into the death of Christian Acosta on or about June 13, 2018, including but not limited to any and all records referencing or involving Tanya Marie Anderson. This request specifically includes, but is not limited to, the following:

 A. Incident & Investigative Reports
  • Initial, supplemental, and closing police reports, detective narratives, and case summaries.
  • Crime scene diagrams, photographs, and video or body-camera footage.
  • Evidence collection logs, property sheets, and chain-of-custody forms.

 B. Medical & Forensic Records
  • DuPage County Coroner’s report, autopsy findings, and toxicology results.
  • EMS run sheets or fire-department responder reports.
  • Any forensic laboratory submissions and results (fingerprints, DNA, drug analysis).

 C. Communications & 911 Audio
  • Computer-aided dispatch (CAD) logs, 911 call recordings, radio traffic, and MDT messages.
  • Emails, texts, or memoranda between Westmont Police Department, DuPage County State’s Attorney’s Office, and any other agency regarding this death investigation.

 D. Interview Materials
  • Witness statements, interview transcripts, and audio/video recordings of interviews of Tanya Marie Anderson, Christian Acosta, Hernando Acosta, or any other person interviewed in connection with the case.

 E. Prosecutorial Disposition
  • Referral letters, charging recommendations, declination memoranda, or case-closure letters issued to or received from the DuPage County State’s Attorney’s Office.
  • All internal memoranda, notes, or communications regarding charging decisions, investigative strategy, or legal analysis of the case.

 F. Administrative & QA Files
  • Any internal-affairs reviews, case-audit worksheets, or supervisory critiques of investigative handling.
  • Retention or destruction logs referencing audio/video or evidence in this case.

III. Time Frame
 Records created or received 1 January 2017 – Present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Electronic format preferred (.pdf, .mp4, .wav, .jpg), delivered via secure download link or encrypted USB.
 • If electronic production is infeasible, please advise of available alternatives.

V. Fee Waiver
 Disclosure will contribute to the public’s understanding of a death investigation involving potential interstate criminal conduct; I therefore request a waiver of any search, duplication, or administrative fees under 5 ILCS 140/6(c). If fees are unavoidable and expected to exceed $50, please provide advance written notice.

VI. Expedited Processing
 The requested records are material to ongoing state and federal proceedings (Dane County Case No. 2023FA836; U.S. Attorney complaint filed June 2025). Prompt release is essential to preserve litigation deadlines.

VII. Preservation Notice
 Please halt routine deletion or recycling that could affect responsive audio/video or digital evidence until this FOIA request is resolved.

VIII. Partial Disclosure & Exemptions
 Should you assert any exemption, produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory basis (5 ILCS 140/7) for each withheld segment. Provide an itemized exemption log sufficient to allow meaningful review.

IX. Preferred Communication
 Kindly confirm receipt of this request via email and direct any questions to the contact information above.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention. I look forward to your written determination within the statutory period prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3(d).

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

title: Wisconsin Open-Records Request—Fraud‐Investigation Materials

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Wisconsin Open-Records Request—Fraud‐Investigation Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To:
 Records Custodian / Open-Records Officer
 Wisconsin Department of Health Services — Office of Inspector General (OIG)
 1 West Wilson Street, Room 650
 Madison, WI 53703

From:
 Alexander Liam Lennon
 215 S Century Ave #227
 Waunakee, WI 53597
 (608) 214-6492 | alennon727@gmail.com

I. Statutory Authority
 Pursuant to Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39 and related common-law principles requiring government transparency in matters of alleged fraud and agency accountability, I respectfully request access to the public records listed in Section II.

II. Records Requested
 A. Case-Specific Investigation Files (2019 – Present)
  1. Entire investigative files—including complaints, intake notes, interview transcripts, audit work-papers, overpayment ledgers, recommended actions, and closing memoranda—relating to FoodShare, Wisconsin Shares, or Pandemic Unemployment Assistance fraud investigations that list Jessica Cooper or Angie Dempewolfe as investigator, analyst, supervisor, or subject.
  2. All correspondence (letters, emails, texts, Teams/Zoom chat logs) between either individual and:
   • Waunakee Police Department personnel;
   • Dane County CPS employees;
   • Assistant District Attorneys Annie Jay or Timothy Verhoff;
   • Tanya Marie Anderson, Tammy Pomplun, or Attorney Elisabeth Bach-Van Horn.

 B. Policy, Training & Delegation Records (2018 – Present)
  1. Current and historical OIG or Division of Quality Assurance manuals, standard-operating procedures, desk guides, or policy bulletins that define:
   • Authority of fraud investigators to refer matters for criminal prosecution;
   • Documentation standards for Intentional Program Violation findings;
   • Duties to disclose exculpatory information to law-enforcement partners.
  2. Training curricula, slide decks, sign-in sheets, and assessment tools provided to Cooper or Dempewolfe regarding common-law fraud elements, theft-by-fraud (Wis. Stat. § 943.20), and civil-restitution procedures (Wis. Stat. § 895.446).

 C. Oversight & Quality-Assurance Data
  1. Internal audits, peer-review summaries, or performance dashboards evaluating fraud-case closures handled by Cooper or Dempewolfe.
  2. Any complaints, disciplinary findings, or supervisory corrective-action plans naming either individual and referencing misrepresentation, negligence, or selective enforcement.

 D. Communications With Federal Partners (2020 – Present)
  • All referrals, memoranda, or email chains between DHS-OIG and USDA-FNS, SSA-OIG, or U.S. Department of Labor-OIG in which Cooper or Dempewolfe are sender, recipient, copy, or subject.

 E. Data-Retention & Destruction Logs
  • Logs or certificates showing deletion or purge decisions affecting any of the requested items.

III. Time Frame
 Unless otherwise indicated, this request covers 1 January 2018 to present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Please provide records in native electronic format (.pdf, .msg, .xlsx, .mp4) via secure download link.
 • If electronic transmission is impracticable, advise of alternative media (USB, disc).

V. Fee Waiver
 • Disclosure will illuminate potential agency misrepresentation and selective enforcement, subjects of significant public interest under State v. Timblin and Kaloti Enterprises, Inc. v. Kellogg Sales Co.; therefore, a fee waiver or reduction is requested.
 • If fees exceed $50, supply an itemized estimate before processing.

VI. Expedited Processing
 • Records are needed for imminent filings in federal civil-fraud and § 1983 litigation; timely access is essential.

VII. Record-Preservation Notice
 • Please preserve all potentially responsive material, even if subject to routine purge schedules.

VIII. Redaction & Withholding
 • If portions are withheld, provide the segregable parts and cite each statutory exemption per Wis. Stat. § 19.36(6).

IX. Preferred Communication
 • Please acknowledge receipt by email and direct all clarifications to the contact information above.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention. I anticipate acknowledgment within ten business days, consistent with agency practice.

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon
 June 13, 2025


Citations:
Cases:
State v. Timblin
United States ex rel. O-Donnell v. Countrywide Home Loans, Inc.
Williams v. Rank & Son Buick, Inc.
Statutes:
See Kaloti Enterprises, Inc. v. Kellogg Sales Co., 283 Wis. 2d 555, 699 N.W.2d 205 (2005)
Restatement (Second) of Agency (1958)
Wisconsin Statutes—Theft by Fraud

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

I. Statutory Authority
 Pursuant to Wisconsin’s Open Records Law (Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39), I respectfully request inspection or copies of the public records described below.

II. Records Requested
 A. Case-Specific Child-Welfare Materials
  1. Entire CPS investigative, assessment, and case-management files—including Initial Assessments, screening decision forms, Safety Plans, Protective Plans, case notes, dictation logs, Safe-Harbor referrals, Safe-Harbor interview videos/transcripts, and closing summaries—for all intakes or referrals naming:
   • Alexander Liam Lennon (DOB [REDACT]),
   • Liam Alexander Lennon (LAL) (DOB [REDACT]),
   • Lincoln Thomas Lennon (LTL) (f.k.a Lincoln Thomas Anderson-Acosta)(LTA) (DOB [REDACT]), 
   • Milania Ximena Lennon (MXL) (f.k.a. Milania Ximena Anderson)(MXA)(DOB [REDACT]), and
   • Tanya Marie Anderson or Tammy Pomplun or Patricia Butler or Jennilynn Gerhard or Hernando Acosta or Sonia Acosta or Caroline Fleming
   between 1 January 2019 and present—including, but not limited to, CPS ID numbers linked to WPD files 21-108846, 22-150587, 22-281057, 23-198723, 23-203060, 23-225308, and 24-117425.
  2. All audio or video recordings created or received by CPS (including Teams/Zoom recordings) relating to the above investigations.
  3. Copies of CHIPS petitions, court reports, permanency-plan reviews, and CASA/GAL reports filed with Dane County Circuit Court relating to the same minors or adults.

 B. Policy & Training Records (2018 – Present)
  1. Current and historical policy manuals, practice directives, and desk guides governing:
   • Parent/attorney access to child interviews;
   • Recording requirements for forensic or school-based interviews;
   • Credibility assessment of child statements and detection of coaching/undue influence;
   • Collaboration with law-enforcement agencies.
  2. Training curricula, agendas, sign-in sheets, slide decks, and post-training evaluations for social-workers or supervisors covering:
   • Safe-Harbor/NICHD forensic-interview standards;
   • Statutory “undue-influence” safeguards under Wis. Stat. § 48.981(3)(c)6;
   • Procedures for documenting and preserving exculpatory information.

 C. Internal-Affairs, Oversight & Complaint Data (2018 – Present)
  1. All citizen complaints, internal investigations, critical-incident reviews, or supervisory memoranda involving social-workers Heather Stertz, Angela Ivan, or Jessica Cooper, where allegations include:
   • Coercive interviewing or counsel exclusion;
   • Selective or biased enforcement;
   • Suppression or destruction of evidence.
  2. Annual Quality-Assurance or Program-Evaluation reports summarizing rule-compliance rates for interview recording and legal-representation accommodations.

 D. Communications & Correspondence (2021 – Present)
  1. All emails, texts, Teams/Zoom chats, and letters (plus attachments) exchanged between:
   • CPS staff (including Stertz, Ivan, Cooper, supervisors, and counsel) and any member of the Waunakee Police Department concerning Petitioner, LAL, or the referenced WPD case numbers;
   • CPS staff and Assistant District Attorneys Annie Jay or Timothy Verhoff;

  2. All meeting agendas, minutes, calendars, or video recordings of multidisciplinary-team or case-staffing meetings at which the above investigations were discussed.

 E. Data-Retention & Destruction Logs
  • Any log, policy, or certificate of destruction indicating deletion, purge, or overwrite of recordings or notes relating to the requested investigations.

III. Time Frame
 Unless otherwise indicated, this request covers 1 January 2021 – present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Electronic copies in native format (.pdf, .msg, .xlsx, .mp4, etc.) are preferred.
 • Where native format is unavailable, provide high-resolution PDFs on a password-protected link, USB drive, or other agreed medium.

V. Fee Request
 • I seek a fee waiver or substantial reduction because release will advance public understanding of CPS operations and inform pending civil-rights litigation.
 • If estimated costs exceed $50, please supply an itemized estimate before proceeding.

VI. Expedited Processing
 • These records are material to imminent filings in a federal § 1983 lawsuit; timely disclosure is therefore requested.

VII. Record Preservation Notice
 • Please suspend routine destruction of any potentially responsive record until this request is fulfilled.

VIII. Redaction & Withholding
 • If portions are withheld, produce the segregable portions and cite each statutory exemption per Wis. Stat. § 19.36(6).

IX. Preferred Communication
 • Please acknowledge receipt by email and direct all follow-up to the contact information above.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention. I look forward to an acknowledgment within ten business days, as contemplated by agency practice.

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon

title: Public Records Request Under Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Public Records Request Under Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To:
 Records Custodian
 Waunakee Police Department
 [CUSTODIAN ADDRESS]
 Waunakee, WI [ZIP]

From:
 Alexander Liam Lennon
 215 S Century Ave #227
 Waunakee, WI 53597
 (608) 214-6492 | alennon727@gmail.com

I. Statutory Authority
 Pursuant to Wisconsin’s Open Records Law (Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31 – 19.39) and all other applicable provisions, I hereby request prompt access to, or copies of, the public records described in Section II.

II. Records Requested
 A. Incident-Specific Materials
  1. Complete investigative files—including initial, supplemental, and closing reports; witness statements; photographs; audio; and video—relating to the following WPD case numbers: 21-108846, 22-150587, 22-165954, 22-281057, 23-099471, 23-198723, 23-203060, 23-225308, 24-117425, and any sub-incident or cross-referenced numbers.
  2. All body-worn-camera footage, cruiser-video, hallway-camera, interview-room video, and audio recordings captured by any WPD member in connection with the above-referenced case numbers.
  3. All CFS/dispatch logs, CAD printouts, radio traffic recordings, and MDT messages for the above incidents.
  4. Copies of search warrants, affidavits, criminal-complaint referrals, charging recommendations, and declination memoranda transmitted to the Dane County District Attorney’s Office for each incident.

 B. Policy & Training Records (2018 – Present)
  1. Current and historical Standard Operating Procedures, General Orders, directives, or memoranda governing:
   • Interview/Interrogation recording requirements (audio or video).
   • Child-abuse investigations, Safe-Harbor/forensic interviews, and predominant-aggressor determinations.
   • Evidence preservation, body-camera retention, and deletion protocols.
  2. Training curricula, lesson plans, attendance rosters, and post-training assessments provided to sworn personnel concerning:
   • Identification and mitigation of coached or recanted child statements.
   • Equal-protection or bias-based-policing prohibitions.

 C. Internal-Affairs & Complaint Data (2018 – Present)
  1. All citizen complaints, internal-affairs investigations, supervisory reviews, and disciplinary findings involving Officers Mitchell Flora, Jason Carbon, or any other member assigned to the referenced case numbers, where allegations include:
   • Fabrication or omission of evidence.
   • Failure to record interviews or activate body-camera equipment.
   • Selective or biased enforcement.
  2. Statistical summaries or annual reports that track use-of-force incidents, arrests, citations, and declinations disaggregated by gender of the alleged aggressor in domestic or child-abuse investigations.

 D. Communications & Correspondence (2021 – Present)
  1. All emails, text messages, Signal/WhatsApp/iMessage chats, body-cam uploads, and memorandum-style correspondence (including drafts and attachments) exchanged between:
   • Any WPD member (sworn or civilian) and members of Dane County CPS relating to Petitioner, his minor son, or the above case numbers;
   • Any WPD member and Assistant District Attorneys Annie Jay or Timothy Verhoff;
   • Any WPD member and Tanya Marie Anderson, Tammy Pomplun, Dr. Donna Rifkin, or Attorney Elisabeth Bach-Van Horn.
  2. All meeting agendas, minutes, or Teams/Zoom recordings where the referenced cases were discussed.

III. Time Frame
 Unless otherwise specified, the requested records span 1 January 2019 – Present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Provide electronic copies in native format when feasible (e.g., .mp4, .mov, .wav, .msg, .pdf).
 • If electronic delivery is impracticable, please advise of available alternatives (secure download, USB, or disc).

V. Fee Request
 • I request a waiver or reduction of fees under the public-interest provisions of Wis. Stat. § 19.35(3)(e) because disclosure will illuminate governmental performance, inform pending litigation, and promote public accountability.
 • If fees will exceed $50, please provide an itemized estimate before processing.

VI. Expedited Processing
 • Records are needed for imminent filings in federal civil-rights litigation (42 U.S.C. § 1983). Undue delay may prejudice my ability to comply with court deadlines; therefore, I respectfully request priority processing.

VII. Record Preservation Notice
 • I place WPD on notice to preserve all responsive records, including any scheduled for routine deletion or overwrite (e.g., body-camera auto-purge).

VIII. Redaction & Withholding
 • If any portion of a record is exempt, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemption for each withheld segment, as required by Wis. Stat. § 19.36(6).

IX. Preferred Communication
 • Direct all correspondence to the contact information above. Email communication is preferred for efficiency.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention to this request. I anticipate your written acknowledgment within 10 business days, consistent with agency practice.

 Sincerely,

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon
 Alexander Liam Lennon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

title: Plans to arrest Cambodian guerrilla leader Pol Pot of the Khmer Rouge (U.S. Department of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request any and all documents related plans put forward by the administration of President Bill Clinton to arrest Pol Pot, the leader of the Cambodia’s Khmer Rouge guerilla organization.

The date range would be between January 1, 1998 and December 31, 1998.

Independent sources corroborate the existence of this material:

https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/11/world/us-seeks-china-s-help-in-arranging-pol-pot-trial.html

https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/09/world/us-is-planning-a-move-to-seize-pol-pot-for-trial.html

https://www.thelocal.se/20090803/21064?gaa_at=eafs&gaa_n=ASWzDAhD433qJE7jn11-t-pDGtozLpexpu-EpCu_sTN0uuOTgxK60DUzVZjT9vXukYw%3D&gaa_ts=684c7ea7&gaa_sig=_2iAUGRRptAMw1CgRfsQ_GU-oDNTh6MLizvQP84mWR0Obov1I5EEL0S9mg-vaeNPlWj-qD-JcsxeQpNH1qROuA%3D%3D


I also hereby request any documents kept in “prohibited access”  filing systems, separated from conventional filing systems (such as Sentinel) in violation of FOIA laws.

Given that 27 years have passed since these files were generated, I expect them to be provided in full, without redactions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mary Patricia Nunan

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1st, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1st, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Security Evaluation Criteria Used to Adopt SolarApp+

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Security Evaluation Criteria Used to Adopt SolarApp+
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Gov. Code § 6250 et seq.), I am requesting access to and copies of any and all records, communications, evaluations, or internal documents related to the City’s decision to implement or endorse the use of SolarApp+ for permitting solar projects.

In particular, I am seeking documents responsive to:
1. Any security assessments, audits, penetration tests, risk evaluations, or cybersecurity reviews conducted by or on behalf of the City prior to, during, or after adoption of SolarApp+.
2. All internal communications, staff emails, memos, or meeting notes discussing the security posture, data protection protocols, or vendor risk associated with SolarApp+.
3. Any contracts, MOUs, or agreements entered into between the City and SolarApp+ or its administering entities that reference system integrity, data handling, or compliance with information security standards.
4. Any communication with DOE, NREL, or associated contractors referencing security, risk, or due diligence in connection with SolarApp+ adoption.

For reference, the City's implementation of SolarApp+ is promoted on the following website: https://www.fairfield.ca.gov/government/city-departments/community-development/building-safety/solar-app. We are aware that similar platforms have undergone extensive technical and security evaluations by the City prior to approval. This request seeks to understand whether the same level of scrutiny was applied in this case.

Please include records regardless of format (emails, PDFs, memos, scanned documents, etc.) and from all relevant staff or departments involved in the decision-making process.

If any part of this request is unclear or overly broad, I am happy to discuss ways to narrow or clarify it. If any portion of the request is being withheld or redacted, please cite the specific exemption and legal justification.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ramon Vega
